CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life (Article 8 - Positive obligations;Article 8-1 - Respect for family life)
JUDGES: András Sajó;Egidijus Kūris;Guido Raimondi;Jon Fridrik Kjølbro;Nebojša Vučinić;Robert Spano
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE ) . The second and third applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and apparently live with their mother in GPE ( GPE ) or somewhere nearby .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the first applicant ’s then wife , whom he had married in DATE and who is the mother of the second and third applicants , took the second and third applicants from GPE , where the family was living , to GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the first applicant travelled to GPE . The family was supposed to return to GPE but the first applicant ’s wife refused to leave and the first applicant returned to GPE alone .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the first applicant joined his family in GPE for DATE and his wife again refused to return to GPE with him and kept the children with her .
CARDINAL . In DATE the first applicant wrote to his wife requesting that she return to GPE with their daughters .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant asked ORG to initiate proceedings for the return of the children to GPE . On DATE he also instigated proceedings before ORG ) for separation from his wife and the return of his daughters to GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE his wife started parallel divorce proceedings before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants lodged a complaint before ORG alleging a violation of LAW ( ORG ) no . DATE concerning GPE and ORG ( “ LAW ” ) , which is still pending .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the marriage between the first applicant and his ex - wife was annulled ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . As at the date of introduction of the present application , the first applicant had been unable to see his daughters since DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Pest Central District Court found that the first applicant ’s ex - wife was keeping the children in GPE illegally , in violation of LAW ( “ LAW ” ) . However , it considered that given their young age , the children needed to be cared for by their mother and therefore refused to order their return to GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of ORG and ordered that the children be returned to GPE by DATE at the latest , but this failed to happen .
CARDINAL . An enforcement order was issued against the first applicant ’s ex - wife by ORG on DATE and upheld by ORG on DATE . The decision was not enforced .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ordered the enforcement of the decision of DATE , this time with the assistance of the police . Again , the decision was not enforced .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the issue of a NORP arrest warrant by the NORP authorities , the first applicant ’s ex - wife was arrested by the NORP police but was released shortly thereafter with no progress having been made regarding a possible return of the second and third applicants to GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , she was sentenced in absentia by the Buda ORG to a DATE fine for illegally changing the custody of a minor .
CARDINAL . On DATE the headmaster of ORG , located in GPE , initiated proceedings before the LOC district guardianship authority to bring the second and third applicants under its protection .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the first applicant and his ex - wife reached an agreement pursuant to which the second and third applicants would remain with their mother in GPE but would be able to visit the first applicant in GPE several times per year . In the light of that agreement , on DATE the first applicant requested the suspension of the enforcement proceedings against his ex - wife , and ORG duly suspended the proceedings until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the first applicant withdrew his enforcement request .

CARDINAL . Following a proposal drafted by the competent ORG ( ORG Szociális PERSON ) ‒ which was of the view that the children were no longer in danger ‒ the ORG discontinued the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG granted exclusive custody of the children to the first applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the first applicant pressed criminal charges against his ex - wife for child abduction .
CARDINAL . On an unknown date ORG sentenced the ex - wife to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , suspended .
CARDINAL . The marriage between the first applicant and his ex - wife was annulled by the ecclesiastical tribunal of the GPE region , whose decision was granted exequatur by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following an appeal by the prosecutor , ORG sentenced the applicant ’s ex - wife to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , suspended .

CARDINAL . The first applicant ’s ex - wife appealed against her conviction before ORG . DATE before the hearing the first applicant withdrew his criminal suit in the hope of appeasing the situation and allowing his ex - wife to travel freely to GPE with their QUANTITY daughters .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of ORG in the light of the first applicant ’s decision to withdraw his criminal suit .
